inclusion.criterion: Subjects between the ages of 18 and 65
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Diagnosis of cluster headache (episodic or chronic)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Lifetime prevalence of at least 2 prior cluster cycles
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Experience one or more attacks/day during baseline period
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Typical cluster period lasting at least 8 weeks
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Present in active cluster period and expected remaining duration of the cluster cycle is at least 8 weeks from Baseline visit
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Able to differentiate headaches from cluster headaches
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Using or agrees to use medically acceptable form of contraception if female of child-bearing potential
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Negative urine pregnancy test prior to study entry if female of child-bearing potential
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Able to understand and comply with all study requirements
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Provides written informed consent prior to any screening procedures being conducted
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Women who are pregnant or lactating
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: History of medical or psychiatric condition that would expose them to an increased risk of a significant adverse event or would interfere with the assessments of efficacy and tolerability during this trial
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Require change in medication or existing regimen of medication for the prophylaxis of cluster in the 4 weeks prior to Baseline visit and for the duration of the trial
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Cluster headaches that typically exceed 4 hours
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Used corticosteroids and nerve blocks from four weeks prior to Baseline visit
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient has a history of cluster headaches, is in an active cluster period, and meets most inclusion criteria. However, the patient's cluster headaches may exceed 4 hours, which could be an exclusion criterion.
